Comment 2: 
I disagree. The largest positive single-precision IEEE 754 value
is (1-2**24)Ã—2**128:

340282346638528859811704183484516925440

which is 10141204801825835211973625643007 less than the bug-report value of:

340282356779733661637539395458142568447

The proper value does convert properly:

fmt.Println(float32(340282346638528859811704183484516925440))
fmt.Printf("0x%04x\n",
math.Float32bits(float32(340282346638528859811704183484516925440)))

3.4028235e+38
0x7f7fffff

This value of 0x7f7fffff is the right bit pattern.
